item.title: Don’t Sell Out Pro-Lifers to Save Obamacare
item.description: Being ‘flexible on Hyde’ could mean voting for a grave evil — facilitating the unjust taking of human lives.

item.title: Don’t Follow the False Sirens of International Law
item.description: An overly formalistic view of international rules not only hurts America and its allies, but it also creates a more lawless world.

item.title: Want to End Shutdowns? Remember the Past and Proceed with Caution
item.description: After last year’s government shutdown, it’s not surprising to see a number of proposals to prevent future shutdowns.

item.title: The U.S. Military Command Plan Needs a Reboot
item.description: The Pentagon’s structural overhaul ought to be matched with the coordination needed to successfully wage large-scale war anywhere.

item.title: China’s Mineral Monopoly Is America’s Achilles’ Heel
item.description: Until the U.S. is no longer dependent on critical minerals from China, the country will use its advantage as a cudgel against us.
